title: 3 John Quiz - Complete Book
description: Test your comprehensive knowledge of the entire book of 3 John with 25 questions covering key events, people, and teachings from all 1 chapters.

questions.question: To whom is the letter of 3 John addressed?
questions.explanation: The letter is addressed to Gaius, whom the elder loves in the truth.

questions.question: What does the elder wish for Gaius above all things?
options: To prosper and be in health
questions.correctAnswer: To prosper and be in health
questions.explanation: The elder wishes above all things that Gaius may prosper and be in health, even as his soul prospers.

questions.question: Why did the elder rejoice greatly concerning the brethren?
options: Because they testified of the truth in Gaius
questions.correctAnswer: Because they testified of the truth in Gaius
questions.explanation: The elder rejoiced when brethren came and testified of the truth that is in Gaius.

questions.question: According to 3 John, what is the elder's greatest joy?
options: Hearing that his children walk in truth
questions.correctAnswer: Hearing that his children walk in truth
questions.explanation: The elder states he has no greater joy than hearing that his children walk in truth.

questions.question: What does Gaius do faithfully according to the elder?
options: Doing good to brethren and strangers
questions.correctAnswer: Doing good to brethren and strangers
questions.explanation: Gaius is commended for faithfully doing whatever he does to the brethren and strangers.

questions.question: What have the brethren borne witness of before the church about Gaius?
questions.explanation: The brethren have borne witness of Gaius' charity before the church.

questions.question: Why did the brethren go forth on their journey, according to verse 7?
questions.explanation: They went forth for his name's sake, taking nothing from the Gentiles.

questions.question: What does the elder say we ought to do regarding such brethren who go forth for the Lord's name's sake?
options: Receive them to be fellowhelpers to the truth
questions.correctAnswer: Receive them to be fellowhelpers to the truth
questions.explanation: We ought to receive such brethren that we may be fellowhelpers to the truth.

questions.question: Who is the man that loveth to have the preeminence among them and receiveth not the elder?
questions.explanation: Diotrephes is the man who loves to have the preeminence and does not receive the elder.

questions.question: What does Diotrephes do against the elder and those who receive brethren?
options: Prates against them with malicious words and casts out those who receive brethren
questions.correctAnswer: Prates against them with malicious words and casts out those who receive brethren
questions.explanation: Diotrephes prates against the elder with malicious words and forbids and casts out those who would receive brethren.

questions.question: What does the elder command Gaius to follow?
questions.explanation: The elder commands to follow that which is good, not evil.

questions.question: According to 3 John, he that doeth good is of whom?
questions.explanation: He that doeth good is of God.

questions.question: Who is commended by all men and the truth itself in 3 John?
questions.explanation: Demetrius hath good report of all men and of the truth itself.

questions.question: What does the elder plan to do instead of writing more with ink and pen?
questions.explanation: The elder trusts he shall shortly see Gaius and speak face to face.

questions.question: What does the elder send to Gaius at the end of the letter?
questions.explanation: The elder sends peace to Gaius and greetings from friends, asking Gaius to greet friends by name.

questions.question: True or False: The elder writes that he rejoiced greatly when the brethren testified of the truth in Gaius.
questions.explanation: The elder clearly states his joy when brethren testified of the truth that is in Gaius.

questions.question: True or False: Diotrephes received the elder and the brethren warmly and with hospitality.
questions.explanation: Diotrephes did not receive the elder and forbade others from receiving brethren.

questions.question: True or False: The brethren who went forth took nothing of the Gentiles for their journey.
questions.explanation: They went forth for the Lord's name's sake, taking nothing from the Gentiles.

questions.question: True or False: The elder says he has greater joy than hearing that his children walk in the truth.
questions.explanation: He states he has no greater joy than hearing that his children walk in truth.

questions.question: True or False: The elder commands Gaius to follow evil and reject good.
questions.explanation: He commands to follow that which is good and not evil.

questions.question: True or False: Demetrius has a good report from all men and from the truth itself.
questions.explanation: Demetrius is commended for his good report by all and the truth itself.

questions.question: True or False: The elder wrote many things to Gaius with ink and pen.
questions.explanation: The elder had many things to write but chose not to write with ink and pen.

questions.question: True or False: The elder asked Gaius to greet friends by name.
questions.explanation: The elder requests Gaius to greet friends by name.

questions.question: True or False: Charity is a key characteristic commended in Gaius by the brethren.
questions.explanation: The brethren witnessed of Gaius' charity before the church.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Beloved, I wish above all things that thou mayest ______ and be in health, even as thy soul prospereth.'
questions.explanation: The elder wishes Gaius to prosper and be in health as his soul prospers.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'I have no greater joy than to hear that my ______ walk in truth.'
questions.explanation: The elder expresses his greatest joy is hearing that his children walk in truth.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Because that for his name's sake they went forth, taking nothing of the ______.'
questions.explanation: They took nothing of the Gentiles for their journey.

questions.question: Complete this verse: 'Beloved, follow not that which is evil, but that which is ______.'
questions.explanation: The elder instructs to follow that which is good and not evil.

questions.question: Who is described as loving to have the preeminence in the church?
questions.explanation: Diotrephes is noted for loving to have the preeminence among them.

questions.question: What action does Diotrephes take against those who would receive the brethren?
options: Forbids them and casts them out of the church
questions.correctAnswer: Forbids them and casts them out of the church
questions.explanation: Diotrephes forbids those who would receive brethren and casts them out.

questions.question: What is the elder's attitude toward evil and good as expressed in 3 John?
options: He commands to follow good and not evil
questions.correctAnswer: He commands to follow good and not evil
questions.explanation: The elder instructs to follow good and reject evil.

questions.question: What testimony does the elder bear concerning Demetrius?
options: He has a good report from all men and the truth
He is disliked by the church
questions.correctAnswer: He has a good report from all men and the truth
questions.explanation: The elder and others bear record of Demetrius' good report.

questions.question: What does the elder hope to do shortly with Gaius?
options: Meet and speak face to face
questions.correctAnswer: Meet and speak face to face
questions.explanation: The elder trusts he will shortly see Gaius and speak face to face.

questions.question: What does the elder request Gaius to do regarding friends?
questions.explanation: The elder asks Gaius to greet friends by name.

questions.question: What is the main theme of 3 John?
options: Walking in truth and showing hospitality
questions.correctAnswer: Walking in truth and showing hospitality
questions.explanation: The epistle emphasizes truth, hospitality, and good conduct among brethren.

questions.question: What does the elder say about those who do evil?
questions.explanation: He states that those who do evil have not seen God.

questions.question: Who is referred to as 'the elder' in the letter?
questions.explanation: The elder is traditionally understood as John the Apostle.

questions.question: What is the purpose of sending forward the brethren after a godly sort?
options: To do well and show hospitality
questions.correctAnswer: To do well and show hospitality
questions.explanation: Sending them after a godly sort is doing well and showing hospitality.

questions.question: True or False: The elder wrote a very long letter to Gaius with many details.
questions.explanation: The elder states he had many things to write but chose not to write with ink and pen.

questions.question: True or False: Gaius is commended for his love in the truth.
questions.explanation: Gaius is described as the wellbeloved whom the elder loves in the truth.

questions.question: True or False: The elder's letter encourages hospitality towards traveling brethren.
questions.explanation: The letter encourages receiving brethren and being fellowhelpers to the truth.

questions.question: Which character in 3 John is associated with malicious words and pride?
questions.explanation: Diotrephes is described as prating against the elder with malicious words and loving preeminence.

questions.question: What does the elder mean by 'Our friends salute thee'?
questions.explanation: The elder is sending greetings from friends to Gaius.

questions.question: What does the phrase 'walk in the truth' imply in the context of 3 John?
options: To physically walk to the church
To live in accordance with Christian truth and integrity
questions.correctAnswer: To live in accordance with Christian truth and integrity
questions.explanation: Walking in truth means living faithfully according to the gospel.

questions.question: What is the relationship between the elder and Gaius described as?
options: Father and son in the truth
questions.correctAnswer: Father and son in the truth
questions.explanation: The elder calls Gaius his beloved and his children, indicating spiritual fatherhood.
